metadata.title: CVE-2019-7653 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Debian python-rdflib-tools 4.2.2-1 package for RDFLib 4.2.2 has CLItools that can load Python modules from the current working directory,allowing code injection, because "python -m" looks in this directory, asdemonstrated by rdf2dot. This issue is specific to use of thedebian/scripts directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-rdflib - 4.1.2-3+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
python-rdflib-tools - 4.1.2-3+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
python3-rdflib - 4.1.2-3+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rdflib package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.2-3+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
